description: From Spanish palmito, diminutive of palma (“palm tree”), from Latin palma.

entries.meaning: Any of various fan palms of the family Arecaceae, especially Sabal palmetto or the saw palmetto, Serenoa repens. [from 16th c.]
examples: [O]n the flat coastal swamps of South Florida, where the palmettos once blew over the detritus of a dozen failed booms and the hotels were boarded up six months a year, there has evolved  […]  a settlement of considerable interest  […] .

entries.meaning: A hat made of palmetto leaves.
A native or resident of the US state of South Carolina.
